content: I need you to print copies of the analysis files from the LR-8211 case and distribute them to the lab techs in Sectors 12 to 15. I'll be fully booked with counselling sessions today so I won't be available, but you can retrieve the updated files from my personal computer with this password: a7akk/o. It’s encrypted, of course, but you can decrypt it using the information in the attached text file. Remember to delete the file when you're done.

It seems some of the lab technicians in Sector 15 have been snooping around the company file system. Please make sure all the testing files are secure. The last thing I need right now is for one of the Directors to order a sector investigation. I’ve got enough on my plate as it is.
The characters of the password are numbered from 0 to n. The password is at least 6 characters long.
The character at index 0 is exchanged with the character at index n-2.
The character at index 1 is exchanged with the character at index n.
Every odd-indexed character is shifted 1 up in the ASCII table.
Note: when characters are swapped their indices change based on their position in the string.

I will be absent for the next few days while I investigate a potential new supplier. You will report to Director Hines in the meantime. Please set up a meeting with her and give her a briefing on the preparation for Experiment MR-4722.
